name: Kepler-248
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-248 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-248 is a star with 0.7250000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.83 times its radius. It is located 2461.34 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-248 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-248 b

Kepler-248 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.31 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-248.

The mass of Kepler-248 b is 13.60 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-248 b is 3.02 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-248 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-248 c

Kepler-248 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.24 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-248.

The mass of Kepler-248 c is 27.92 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-248 c is 4.07 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-248 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-248, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
